name: Formaldehyde
reasons: Known human carcinogen; Releases vapours that can cause sensitization
regulatory_CA: restricted (not permitted in aerosols; max 0.2% as preservative; special limits)
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Cosmetics Regulation
source_scientific: IARC Monograph; SCCS Opinion on formaldehyde and MG

name: Benzene
reasons: Known human carcinogen
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (prohibited)

name: Lead and its compounds
reasons: Reproductive toxicity; Neurotoxic heavy metal
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (prohibited)

name: Mercury compounds (incl. Thimerosal)
reasons: Neurotoxicity and reproductive toxicity; bioaccumulation
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex II

name: Cadmium and its compounds
reasons: Carcinogenic heavy metal
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (prohibited); EU Annex II

name: Arsenic and its compounds
reasons: Carcinogenic heavy metal
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex II

name: Chromium VI compounds (as Cr VI)
reasons: Carcinogenic; strong skin sensitizer
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex II

name: Coal tars (crude and refined)
reasons: Contains PAHs with carcinogenic potential
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (prohibited)

name: 1,4-Dioxane (as contaminant)
reasons: Probable human carcinogen; contaminant in ethoxylated surfactants
regulatory_CA: prohibited (as added); impurity should be minimized
regulatory_EU: prohibited (Annex II when used as substance)
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex II

name: Benzidine and its salts
reasons: Known human carcinogen
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex II

name: Nitrosamines (N-nitrosodiethanolamine etc.)
reasons: Potent carcinogens; should not be present
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex II

name: Parabens (Methyl-, Ethyl-, Propyl-, Butyl-)
reasons: Endocrine activity; restrictions in certain regions
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (restrictions); EU SCCS opinions

name: Phthalates (e.g., DEHP, DBP)
reasons: Reproductive toxicity; endocrine disruption
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex II

name: Oxybenzone (Benzophenone-3)
reasons: Endocrine activity data; environmental (coral) concern
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (restrictions); EU SCCS 2021 opinion

name: Hydroquinone
reasons: Skin sensitization; strict limits by product type
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (restrictions); EU Annex III

name: p-Phenylenediamine (PPD)
reasons: Strong sensitizer; restricted to oxidative hair dyes
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex III

name: Resorcinol
reasons: Irritation/sensitization; not permitted for general skin use
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex III

name: Triclosan
reasons: Environmental persistence; endocrine activity concerns; strict oral limits
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU opinions

name: Methylisothiazolinone (MI)
reasons: Potent contact sensitizer; not permitted in leave-on in CA/EU
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex V/III decisions

name: Methylchloroisothiazolinone/Methylisothiazolinone (MCI/MI)
reasons: Potent sensitizer; only allowed in rinse-off at low levels
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex V/III

name: Alpha-Hydroxy Acids (e.g., Glycolic, Lactic)
reasons: Irritation/photosensitivity; concentration and pH limits
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex III (various)

name: Salicylic Acid
reasons: Irritation; concentration limits by product type
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex III

name: Retinol and its esters (Vitamin A)
reasons: Concentration limits; potential irritation/photosensitivity
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (limits)

name: Retinal (Retinaldehyde)
reasons: Concentration limits by product type
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist

name: Benzophenone
reasons: Sensitization concerns; limits apply
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex III

name: Benzoyl Peroxide (nails)
reasons: Irritation; professional-use limits in nails
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist

name: Aluminum Chloride (Antiperspirant)
reasons: Aerosol prohibition; concentration and form limits
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (conditions)

name: Aluminum Chlorohydrate & complexes
reasons: Concentration limits; not combined with other aluminum complexes
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (conditions)

name: Aluminum Zirconium complexes
reasons: Not permitted in aerosols; concentration limits
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (conditions)

name: Boric acid and borates
reasons: Reproductive toxicity concerns; strict use limits
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist

name: Methanol (Methyl alcohol)
reasons: Toxic if ingested; child-resistant container rules
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (conditions)

name: Methylene Chloride (Dichloromethane)
reasons: Suspected carcinogen; not allowed in aerosols
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist

name: 1,3-Butadiene (as impurity in propellants)
reasons: Known carcinogen; limit in butane/isobutane (<0.1% w/w)
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (limit)

name: Talc (loose powders)
reasons: Inhalation hazard; genital use restrictions; max % in loose powders
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (conditions)

name: Fragrance / Parfum (allergens)
reasons: Undisclosed mixture; EU allergen labeling list
source_regulatory: EU Annex III Fragrance allergens; IFRA

name: Sodium Lauryl Sulfate (SLS)
reasons: Skin/eye irritation; aquatic toxicity
source_regulatory: General cosmetic permissions

name: Sodium Laureth Sulfate (SLES)
reasons: Irritation potential; may contain 1,4-dioxane as impurity if not vacuum-stripped
source_regulatory: General cosmetic permissions

name: Phenoxyethanol
reasons: Restricted typically to ≤1% in many jurisdictions
source_regulatory: EU Annex V; Health Canada positions

name: BHA (Butylated Hydroxyanisole)
reasons: Potential carcinogenicity/endocrine effects; limits apply
source_regulatory: Prop 65; EU opinions

name: BHT (Butylated Hydroxytoluene)
reasons: Endocrine activity data; allowed with limits
source_regulatory: EU opinions; general allowances

name: Toluene-2,5-diamine (and sulfate)
reasons: Sensitizer; labeling and usage restrictions
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex III

name: Tricresyl phosphate
reasons: Neurotoxicity concerns
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex II

name: Talc (with asbestos-free specification)
reasons: Ensure asbestos-free; follow Canadian limits
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist

name: Benzalkonium chloride
reasons: Irritation/sensitization; leave-on limits
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist

name: Benzethonium chloride
reasons: Not for mucous membranes; limits for leave-on/rinse-off
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist

name: Sodium perborate / Peroxides
reasons: Oral and eye-area restrictions; labeling and max % apply
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (Peroxide section)

name: Eucalyptus oil (certain chemotypes)
aliases: Eucalyptus globulus leaf oil|Eucalyptus radiata oil
reasons: Child safety labeling; ingestion hazard warnings
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist

name: Methyl eugenol (as fragrance component)
reasons: Strict concentration caps by product type
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist; EU Annex III

name: Triclocarban
reasons: Environmental concerns; restricted/banned in some regions
source_regulatory: Regulatory communications (various)

name: Bisphenol A (BPA)
reasons: Endocrine disruption; restrictions across regulators
source_regulatory: Health Canada Hotlist (prohibited entry for BPA); EU measures
